name: 2,5-dichlorothiophene
Reason: 2,5-dichlorothiophene has a basic unit of thiophene, which has a melting point of -38.4 degrees Celsius. The introduction of two chlorine atoms increases the molecular weight and size, which generally raises the melting point. However, chlorine is also more electronegative than carbon, which can increase the dipole moment and intermolecular dipole-dipole interactions. Each chlorine atom can raise the melting point by approximately 10 degrees Celsius due to the increased molecular weight and dipole-dipole interactions.
